title: erigon+lighthouse  error
body:
Did you encounter this problem again?
Execute lighthouse and report an error:


Sep 16 03:38:10.379 WARN Execution endpoint is not synced        action: trying fallback, last_seen_block_unix_timestamp: 1663260095, endpoint: http://127.0.0.1:8551/, auth=true, service: deposit_contract_rpc
Sep 16 03:38:10.379 ERRO No synced execution endpoint            advice: ensure you have an execution node configured via --execution-endpoint or if pre-merge, --eth1-endpoints, service: deposit_contract_rpc
Sep 16 03:38:10.379 ERRO Error updating deposit contract cache   error: "All fallbacks errored: http://127.0.0.1:8551/, auth=true => EndpointError(FarBehind)", retry_millis: 60000, service: deposit_contract_rpc

I have encountered this problem.
I run the lighthouse with --reconstruct-historic-states, and the erigon normal synchronization

> I have encountered this problem. I run the lighthouse with --reconstruct-historic-states, and the erigon normal synchronization

Hello, I still get an error after adding this command

I run erigon with the command:
```
./build/bin/erigon --datadir /home/data/mainnet --ethash.dagdir /home/data/thash --private.api.addr=localhost:9090  --authrpc.addr=127.0.0.1  --http=false --override.terminaltotaldifficulty=0xc70d808a128d7380000  --verbosity=3 2>&1 | tee log/erigon.log &
```
run the lighthouse:
```
./lighthouse --network mainnet beacon  --execution-endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8551 --reconstruct-historic-states  --execution-jwt /home/data/mainnet/jwt.hex --datadir ./here
```

after the erigon catch up with the latest block, the lighthouse's error didn't show up.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32100315/190557422-d5223360-546a-460d-a43f-7d740d8ccb6f.png)

> > I have encountered this problem. I run the lighthouse with --reconstruct-historic-states, and the erigon normal synchronization
> 
> Hello, I still get an error after adding this command

This error may be that erigon is too far behind

> > > 我遇到了这个问题。我使用 --reconstruct-historic-states 运行灯塔，并使用 erigon 正常同步
> > 
> > 
> > 你好，添加这个命令后还是报错
> 
> 这个错误可能是 erigon 太后了

Excuse me, is your lighthouse started directly? Are there any pre-operations?

> > > > 我遇到了这个问题。我使用 --reconstruct-historic-states 运行灯塔，并使用 erigon 正常同步
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 你好，添加这个命令后还是报错
> > 
> > 
> > 这个错误可能是 erigon 太后了
> 
> Excuse me, is your lighthouse started directly? Are there any pre-operations?

yeah, start directly, no pre-operations.
any luck with this? I am having the same issue not sure if this is an erigon or lighthouse issue.
same here. please update if you have any workaround.

I have the same problem, erigon freshly started ends up at "Waiting for consensus layer...". Lighthouse connects and errors with this same error.

`erigon version 2.28.1-stable-9711af6d`
`Lighthouse v3.2.1-6d5a2b5`
@almindor Have you fixed your problem? I am also encountering the same problem and is stuck with 2/16 Waiting For Consensus Layer

> @almindor Have you fixed your problem? I am also encountering the same problem and is stuck with 2/16 Waiting For Consensus Layer

No, I'm about to give up on erigon for now.
I had a similar problem when using btrfs. I switched to xfs and I started from scratch. After a week all was good. Not sure if the filesystem is the problem. But worth a shot.

> I had a similar problem when using btrfs. I switched to xfs and I started from scratch. After a week all was good. Not sure if the filesystem is the problem. But worth a shot.

I'm using basic ext4, I don't suspect this has anything to do with that.

> same here. please update if you have any workaround.

This is what I did on systemd. First run erigon node then run lighthouse and after a few days, the problem is solved.

> > same here. please update if you have any workaround.
> 
> This is what I did on systemd. First run erigon node then run lighthouse and after a few days, the problem is solved.

I've got mine running for over a week now and lighthouse keeps reporting the same error over and over. Erigon seems to just be stuck on waiting for POS.

@almindor For mine, I just left it for 5 days not bothering it and now I am at 7/16. After checking the logs the beacon node have not synced fully hence Erigon was stuck. I am using the same version as you for both.

> @almindor For mine, I just left it for 5 days not bothering it and now I am at 7/16. After checking the logs the beacon node have not synced fully hence Erigon was stuck. I am using the same version as you for both.

Did lighthouse report 
```
ERRO Error updating deposit contract cache   error: Failed to get remote head and new block ranges: EndpointError(FarBehind), retry_millis: 60000, service: deposit_contract_rpc
```

though?
@almindor Yes I did get that. My apologies, currently I am not on my laptop. However you should also see something like " INFO   Syncing " on your beacon node.

> > @almindor For mine, I just left it for 5 days not bothering it and now I am at 7/16. After checking the logs the beacon node have not synced fully hence Erigon was stuck. I am using the same version as you for both.
> 
> Did lighthouse report
> 
> ```
> ERRO Error updating deposit contract cache   error: Failed to get remote head and new block ranges: EndpointError(FarBehind), retry_millis: 60000, service: deposit_contract_rpc
> ```
> 
> though?

Hi  I got the same issue , did you fix it ? thanks

I just waited for my beacon node to finish syncing and then Erigon will start syncing.

> I just waited for my beacon node to finish syncing and then Erigon will start syncing.

so this error doesn't affect the synchronization ? just waiting for it ...
May I ask another question ? How long the syncing takes?  my est-time is around 1 day , is that too long ? 
8CPU 64Gi RAM
Thanks :)

Well, it took me 5 days. Yea it does not affect as long as you see that your beacon node is syncing.
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
